description:
Insights for leaders and their organizations

http://vimeo.com/74770690 We live in times of unprecedented change and this is having a significant impact on how we live and work. What are the emerging challenges in the workplace and how are some people and their organizations dealing with these? Gerry Murray will present key findings from Wide Circle's recent study Exploring the future of work. It contains many implications for Leaders and their organizations. Nearly 400 people from around the world participated in the study and shared their insights and best practices. There is much to learn...

Getting the most out of your workspace

With the growing trend of virtual working and flexitime, Francesca Puccio will talk about how to ensure your working environment is conducive to you being productive and creative. She'll show you examples and give you tips on how to improve your work space, whether it's a home office or your space in a conventional office building.

So, come join us for an evening of learning, discussion and fun. Drinks and snacks will be provided and there'll be a tombola where you can win some valuable prizes.

Presentations:[masked]

Social Networking:[masked]

Admission

Free

Capacity is limited so registration is necessary to secure your place. 

Speakers

Francesca Puccio

Gerry Murray
name: What will work be like in the future?

description:
https://vimeo.com/76328481

In the current marketplace, marketing and sales continue to evolve. The websites and messaging of even a decade ago already seem out of date. The same is true of business conversations: how many of today's busy managers are likely to respond well to "How about we meet to introduce ourselves?"

Hanna Kuikka and John Niland will share the ups and downs of marketing during 2013. What works? How is buying behaviour changing? What implications does that have for getting our message "out there"?

So, come join us for an evening of learning, discussion and fun. Drinks and snacks will be provided and there'll be a tombola where you can win some valuable prizes.

Logistics

Registration & Welcome Drinks:[masked]

Presentations:[masked]

Social Networking:[masked]

Admission

Free

Capacity is limited so registration is necessary to secure your place. 

Speakers

John Niland and Hanna Kuikka
name: Creating Opportunity in Today's Economy

description:
The world of working is changing. Our previous evening talks already investigated some aspects of this. Tonight, 


Olga Urrutia

will provide us with some insight into the generational changes that have occurred over the past decades and that are coming up. Who are we and who are they? 

Donatienne Brasseur

will focus on the last generation and how companies are starting to feel the pressure to adapt to their different requirements and world vision. 

So, come join us for an evening of learning, discussion and fun. Drinks and snacks will be provided and there'll be a tombola where you can win some valuable prizes.

Presentations:[masked]

Social Networking:[masked]

Admission

Free

Capacity is limited so registration is necessary to secure your place. Please RSVP on this page.
name: New generation, different organisations?

description:
https://vimeo.com/84310587

Is starting an independent business in Belgium really so complicated?


In the ever changing legal environment, how do you prepare for a new adventure without taking too many risks? Should you join an existing franchise or develop your own idea? 

If you envisage starting a business, you will learn practical and useful information from two leading experts: 

Koen D’Hoore will share his experience concerning starting an independent business, fully or complementary. How to decide which form and how to get started? What are the requirements and procedures? Under what status should you start? Is a company needed? What about social security, VAT and Tax?

Koen will explain the basic information to set you on the right track and get you started.

Tristan Krstic will talk about the risks of working as an independent, compared to the risks of setting up a company which develops the same business. He will also explain the practical and legal differences between a commercial and regular lease contract, or a leasing contract for your offices. He will then go into the advantages and disadvantages of a franchise for starting a new business.

So, come and join us for an evening of learning, discussion and fun. Drinks and snacks will be provided and there’ll be a tombola where you can win some valuable prizes.

how_to_find_us: Please ring the doorbell for Quaker House and we'll come fetch you...
name: Thinking of starting a business in Belgium?

description:
What we experience often is a feeling of being stuck. We try to apply solutions that we know because they proved to work well in the past. But we're living in a world with constant change and movement.

What was true yesterday won't be slightly true today... and not at all tomorrow. There are things we don't consider because of habits and common practices. Therefore, we often miss opportunities.

It is vital to be able detect our blind spots, but how?

What are the principles, approaches and tools for individuals as well as groups and teams ?

Join us to:

• Learn how to detect the signals and reconnect to your feelings and intuitions to discover the other ways

• Find inspiring ways that are there but you don't see yet, get unstuck and readapt when you need it as an individual or a team

We will present two seemingly very different ways to help accomplish this.

Your presenters:

Daniel Reszka is a “Ruby on Rails’ developer and coaching the IT sector using NLP and Agile approaches to help teams attain their levels of excellence.

Marcia O’Regan is an international Colour Therapist, Trainer using the power and knowledge of colour to give people a fresh perspective on their lives, by helping them to gain clarity, increased energy and reassurance to confidently take their next steps in life.

Admission

Free

Capacity is limited so registration is necessary to secure your place. Please RSVP on this page.
how_to_find_us: Ring the bell for Quaker House
name: How to thrive in a world of constant change...

description:
Francesca Puccio:

"In my very first job in small engineering consultancy I remember the sense of oppression that I felt in my chest every time I step in the office in the morning. 
The job was not my favourite and my boss could have been better, but there was something about the office space that made my body shudder (or a better word...to say that I sort of shrank and felt oppressed). There was not enough sun-light, the furniture was practical but dull and grey, the whole place was simply not inspiring. 

But what is an inspiring space?  Come and see examples of interesting work places and learn what you can do to make small but significant improvements in the spaces you live and work. "


John Niland:

“Some months ago, I started researching what people need in order to create more opportunity. I expected to hear about skills, strategies, social media and so on. However, the majority of professionals talked about confidence, identity, self-belief and resilience in the face of adversity. 

It appears we have more need of inspiration than ever.  Whether one is struggling with a shortage of new business, a demanding boss, a lack of feedback or an overwhelming workload, the challenge is to find sufficient inspiration to overcome adversity and to thrive in the face of change. 

So how are people doing that? What works? Let me share with you what has been put forward so far and perhaps you will be tempted to take part in this ongoing research.”

Presentations:[masked]

Social Networking & Discussion:[masked]

Admission

Free

Capacity is limited so registration is necessary to secure your place. Please RSVP on this page. 

Your speakers

Francesca Puccio is a renovation specialist who supports busy home and business owners. Using her vision, style and expertise she improve interiors and make the whole renovation experience enjoyable and fulfilling.

John Niland (www.vco-global.com) works with professionals who want to increase the value of their work, get more business and grow their reputation.
name: Inspiration at work: with Francesca Puccio and John Niland

description:
EFTC (Education for the Children Foundation) is a UK based charity that has founded a school in one of the poorest areas in Jocotenango, Guatemala, in order to provide education for almost 600 children in that area. 

EFTC's mission is to break the cycle of poverty through education, empowerment and enterprise at the heart of the community. EFTC works in partnership with disadvantaged families, children and young adults in Guatemala, Central America to ensure they develop the tools they need to get into the workplace. 

We have a friendly EFTC community of supporters here in Brussels and we would like to invite you for an information evening to hear more about what EFTC does, what EFTC city groups are and to see what we have planned for the 28th June as a delicious Guatemalan coffee fundraiser. 

You're welcome to join us for an evening of interesting information, socialising and fun!
name: Breaking the cycle of poverty: an info evening about EFTC

description:
Come and join us after work on the first Monday of every month :)

Whether you are new in town, or wish to connect with old and new friends, you are welcome.

Purely social, no presentations… just humans enjoying the company of each other! Drinks and snacks provided.

This will be a regular event, on the first Monday of every month. So mark your calendar now!
how_to_find_us: Metro: Georges Henri. On the Montgomery side of Square Vergote. Not to be confused with Bvd Auguste Reyers 158, which is on the Diamant side of Square Vergote.
name: First Monday Meetup
